content.description: This unique line climbs The Mentor through the roof and then traverses left across obvious pockets, huecos, and edges to join the anchors of Sensory Overload.
content.location: Starts on Mentor and finishes on Sensory Overload.

content.description: A harder version of the Hype. Sloping edges and pinches down low, the difficulty eases above the powerful crux.
content.location: Between Don't Believe the Hype and Hell Comes to Frogtown.

content.description: Tenuous pulls between sloping edges and pinches below the high roof. Powerful route that joins the finish of Mentor.
content.location: Start right of the Mentor, a long sling is useful on the first bolt.

content.description: Shares the start of Bowser and Mars.  Climb up through edges in orange rock on Mars, just below the roof cut right past a deadpoint through sloping holds. Climb straight up into fine edge climbing in gray rock.
content.location: Shares start of Bowser and Mars, right trending line.

content.description: On the left side of the cave proper, shouldery pulls between pockets through the roof lead up to edges and sloping pockets on the finishing headwall.
content.location: First route left from the very middle of the cave proper.

content.description: Large juggy flake leads up to a reachy pocket move past the dreaded "devil bush".
A line of bolts left of The Mentor through the steepest section of the Mentor Cave. Difficulty unknown.
content.location: Line leading left from the starting ramp of the Mentor.

content.description:
Super classic!  If you can stand the road noise and the guys breaking into your car, this is the route you want to be doing while you are here.  

  Climbs out the Mentor cave (just right of the Blasphemy wall) on great pockets, edges, sidepulls... the whole kitchen sink.  Very Steep! 

  Somewhere toward the middle you even get a leg thread to cop a rest.   

  Once you pull out of the cave onto the headwall, you lose sight of your belayer - and the road noise ensures you can't communicate verbally. Just a heads up.   

  In spite of the irritations of the VRG, this route still gets 4 stars.
content.location:
Mentor cave, right of the Blasphemy wall 

  Obvious route right in the middle.

content.description: A brief boulder problem compared to many of the other routes in the VRG.  Long pulls through the first few bolts lead to a very powerful and sustained V9 boulder problem crux.
content.location: Shortest of the routes in the cave, right slanting rails low on the route help identify it. Chalked line just right of Surrender Dorothy.

content.description: Shares the start of Bowser, continue straight up at third bolt through bouldery crimp moves (left most line of bolts after leaving Bowser). Stout edges in the black rock cap off this power style route.
content.location: Starts on Bowser, climbs up, then left trending line.

content.description: Sharpish pockets and crimps climb up low angle gray rock to the right of Brutus.

This line climbs up the orange swath of rock just left of Brutus. Various pockets and chipped edges lie between powerful pulls. Some of the best crimp and edge climbing round out the headwall which shares the anchors of Brutus
content.location: Just left of Brutus, climbs through orange rock.

content.description: This fun line makes for a good warmup for the harder routes in the cave.  Scramble up through some dirt and loose rock to the first bolt about 15ft up.  Fortunately from here the route improves greatly.  From the ledge head up using a combination of holds to a big move right on slightly smaller holds.  From here pull out of the steep stuff and enjoy the slabby intriguing finish.
content.location: Start at the far right side of the Mentor Cave.  Scramble up on blocks for the first 15ft to the first bolt.  Start is shared with Corrosion.

content.description: A Mentor Cave endurance route, links the most difficult climbing on Bowser and Wowser. Start on Bowser, continue traversing through the roof across the lip to join the pockets and huecos on Wowser.
content.location: Climbs most of Bowser, traverses across Mentor and finishes on Wowser.

content.description: Left leaning diagonal sequence that shares the same finish as Mentor past the large/final roof to the head wall.
content.location: Second route to the right of Mentor. Right of Subterfuge (5.13a), which is located in between Mentor and Bowser.

content.description: The Mentor Cave is the obvious cave on the right side of the southern walls.  Routes are a little shorter, but steeper.
